title: Loam Pass is your Season Ticket to Bike Parks Everywhere!
content:
Forget ski passes, the Loam Pass is your multi-park season ticket to ride 30 of the best mountain bike destinations in the US.

And it’s not just parks. The Loam Pass includes shuttle services and resorts, too, giving you two days at each spot for one price. Even if you only hit a few of them, the pass pays for itself quickly. But plan your summer road trip around it and it’s an absolute steal.

The full list of parks and shuttle services are on their website, but highlights include spots like Moab, Pisgah, Burke, Vail, Pisgah, and epic trails all through the PNW.

The Loam Pass is currently $249 per year and includes two days (or uses, depending on the service) each at 30 destinations. They’re continually adding more spots, and say the price will increase as more options are added.

It includes a digital pass, held in their app, where you can also book or reserve shuttles and lift tickets. Or just show the pass at the ticket window to get your day pass. The price gets you other discounts and perks at some spots, too, and a physical pass is available for $20 more and includes stickers and other fun stuff.
